SENT.plain: Primary leptomeningeal lymphoma (PLML) is a rare disease
The most common presentation is symptoms of increased intracranial pressure
Confusion, dysarthria, hearing loss, paraparesis and lumbosacral spinal root symptoms have also been reported
Chemotherapy and radiotherapy have been tried, but its prognosis is usually poor
We experienced a case of PLML with a relatively benign course in an 18-year-old girl
Initial diagnosis was made as idiopathic intracranial hypertension
Lumbosacral shunt was done with good response for 3 years
When headache recurred, she was reevaluated and was correctly diagnosed as PLML
